name: International Palms Resort & Conference Center Cocoa Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were assigned this hotel after winning on a bidding website. We were obviously leery after reading some of the reviews, but we figured it couldn't be too bad for one night and $50. The hotel is located near the end of the hotel strip, but worked out great with our rental car. There is a Denny's restaurant right across the street, and the on site restaurant looked very nice. When we arrived, we were pleasantly suprised at the exterior and the beautiful lobby. Check in was quick and efficient, with Ennis providing great and friendly service. We asked for a renovated room, and he was happy to oblige. Our room faced the pool, so there was a short walk through an outside corridor to reach it from the parking lot, and we did notice quite a bit of noise late into the night from the pool area. I attribute this more to the Saturday night drinking crowd than to any fault of the hotel. We noticed that all the sidewalks had water pooling on them from the air conditioners, so beware of slip hazards. Our room was perfectly fine. The bedding and furnishings were new and very attractive. There were a few cosmetic issues that the picky people looking for flaws would find (the lip in the sink was full of black mold that reflected in the mirror, the bathroom had been freshly painted with new tiling, but they put the old rusty shower rod back up) but we were very pleased with the room. I do hate the dreaded double beds, though. We weren't able to choose due to our low rate, but I wish hotels would do queens instead of doubles. The courtyard area was extremely nice, with a fantastic pool area, basketball court, sand volleyball, beach front restaurant, nice decorations, and great access to the beach. We did not see any trash or debris anywhere on the property as reported in previous reviews. Frankly, we wondered if we were staying at the same hotel as in those reviews. We found this resort to be fantastic, and could have easily spent a few days just using the facilities here, and enjoying the beach. I would probably not get a pool front room again, because of the noise, but we have had the same problem in $300 a night hotels as well. I would definately stay at this hotel again, and kudos to the staff for their excellent service. We have simple tastes and don't look to go picking a place apart, and we were very pleased here.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: The First room was so moldy and a beautiful view of the trash laden parking lot... kind of scary area... front desk staff was VERY nice... so they upgraded us to ocean view.. first floor so you couldn't see the ocean really.... no the bathroom was too nasty for me... We decided to ask for our money back and go somewhere else... so glad we did... for $6 more we got into the 4 Points Sheraton...lovely place... if your looking for a Spring Break type of place International Palms might be ok for you !
reviews.title: Not good... I suppose if all you care about is on the beach it might be OK..

reviews.text: I was apprehensive when we booked this hotel due to all the reviews on Trip Advisor. Our event was being held at the hotel. So it was ideal to simply book at the event site/hotel. If you are looking for a place close to the beach and to sleep this is the place. I saw a lot of the reviews stated roach infestation. I never saw a roach in the room. My only complaints would be you hear anyone who is talking/walking by your room (Nothing can be done as this is an old exterior hotel) and the A/C did not cool the room until we turned the A/C unit to 65 degrees. The bathroom was not the cleanest I have ever been in but it was way better than a truck stop motel.
reviews.title: Old party hotel

reviews.text: very little in some departments. No free breakfast as advertised and one of the reasons I booked here- but Dennys is close enough lol! Couple flaws found in room- but come on, what do you really expect? Its not that bad! Microwave and fridge in room, coffee pot in ummm bathroom? Alrighty then lol. Its on a beatiful beach! Location and price are worth it! I recomend!
reviews.title: Needs little work- very little in some departments.

reviews.text: I booked a wedding and reception package for my wedding back in April, horrible experience! First I sat down and booked my wedding, paid the deposit required then got a call hours later stating that there was a double booking for that time and day I chose (I was ok with moving that, no problems). There is a two story bar right next to the area for the ceremony so I was naturally concerned about bands etc going on while the nuptials were taking place, I was assured by the rep that not only would there not be anything going on but also my family could stand on the second story and watch the ceremony since I had over the 100 people max attending. Now when the big day came the wedding scheduled before me started 45 minutes late due to a family emergency (most likely someone was just late, not an emergency), worst part was that NOONE let us know about it so my guests were standing around confused about what was going on while I was oblivious to the situation. That isn't even the worst part, the wedding party before me had the 2nd story of the bar booked for their reception while my ceremony was supposed to be going on, so now not only was there a full blown party going on above us but also 20 of my guest had nowhere to sit or stand, I was told both by the person incharge of the wedding bookings and the bar waitress that this would NOT happen. The bridezilla refused to ask the DJ to turn off the music for 5 minutes so we could rush through everything so we decided to us the second ceremony back up option inside, place looked like a run down room where we were told "there's the closet, go ahead and set up the chairs". I dropped 10K for this wedding while the other party only paid for the dune fee seeing as the bar is not owned by the resort, when I vocalized my fustration to the rep about not being told about the delay and everything else she replied "I don't care about this right now, I have another wedding going on." Total crap, she continuously told me that she wasn't a wedding planner so why was she catering to this group of maybe 30 people while 120 of my guests were put to the side? wasted 1.5 hours of my DJ useage and no apologies. My package also came with chocolate covered strawberries or something in the honeymoon suite, never received that either.
reviews.title: Ok to stay, don't get married here though...
Dirty, smelly disgusting place, I will NEVER return!
reviews.text: I just returned home from staying there for 3 nights and you couldn't pay me to return. This was a prepaid vacation through allegiant air so we weren't sure how to get our $ back to go to a different hotel or we would have. The 1st room they gave us was horrid! It smelled bad from the outside and was even worse after you opened the door(like you needed a hazmat suit to breathe). Everything was dirty, there was mold and rust all over in the bathroom, paint was peeling off the wall and the outlets didn't work. We complained and got switched to a "newly remodeled room. It smelled better but there was still mold in the bathroom, the fridge was rusty and room overall was very dingy, especially the bathroom.Some outlets didn't work in this room either. The only plus was they did have a lot of fun outdoor things for kids to do. They had a cool pool, basketball court, sand volleyball, shuffle board, some playground equipment and the beach. The bad thing is our 2 rooms were so bad I wouldn't let my kids sleep in that filth.

reviews.title: Awesome Price and Great Stay!
reviews.text: I was PLEASANTLY surprised with this trip! I stayed here on a Friday night with 3 of my friends for my bachelorette party. When we got there, I had booked the wrong room on the website and Mark at the front desk changed it to the family room with a king and 3 bunk beds. He was great! He got us the room with no problem, check in took about 5 minutes. We asked if he could change our check out time from 11 to 12, got it! Then when we got to the room, they called us and said they were changing it to 2! We asked him about restaurants and bars, and he gave us great suggestions! The room was awesome! Clean, smelled good, and plenty of room for 4 girls and all of our stuff! The ONLY minor issue was the tub, it drained really slow, so we couldn't take showers back to back. The food, service, and prices were great at Mambos, and the pool is huge! All the staff was very helpful. I was a little sketchy from reading the reviews on this hotel, but when we got there we were amazed! Everything was clean and nice decor, smelled great (no moldy smell)! It is huge! There is volleyball, basketball, shuffleboard AND tennis courts! Arcade room, and fitness room. My friends and I will DEFINITELY be coming back! And I will also be bringing my daighter there because they have a pirate ship kid pool area! AWESOME! I will definitley recommend this hotel to all my friends and family!

reviews.title: old, dirty, not worth the price.
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights to visit family. We have 3 young kids and the pool / play area was great for them. But that was the ONLY good thing about the place. Very dated, very old, and dirty. It felt like a scummy motel- not the "resort" they are pretending to be. Our feet turned black from the dirty floors in the room. The room smelled old and musty, was very tiny, and just felt allover gross and dirty. The sheets felt rough and cheap, and there wasnt even a blanket, the bed was uncomfortable. I feel really ripped off - especially once I saw that the Hampton Inn down the street had rooms for less $ (I love Hampton Inns). I have actually stayed at the Motel 6 down the road before and thought it was a nicer room for half the price. They can call themselves a resort if they want, but it is a joke. Very dissapointed...

reviews.title: exscaping the rat race
reviews.text: my wife and i experience our first stay two yrs ago and have been coming every since, resently introduce our little get away to our married two daughter and their husbands this past weekend they love it....now we have another small family get away spot... I love it for myself as well,a small drive from my everything rat race to a quite peaceful relaxing atmosphere,,,,, highly recommend it......A special thanks to Management excellent job......JPorter

reviews.title: not worth it
reviews.text: I was very disappointed by this trip. There was bad service at Captain's Grill. Our room had dirty sandy sheets when we checked in. The stove only had to functioning burners in the villa we stayed in. The coupon values were not upheld at breakfast or at the rental stand. The food at the Captain's grill was cold and sloppy. Overall it was a waste of money in my opinion. The only thing I liked about the hotel was the proximity to the beach and mambo's grill/bar.

reviews.title: This place is simply ghastly!
reviews.text: We have just checked into this hotel. The property is grossly misrepresented as a 3-star property on most sites, and some go up to 4-star. Specifically stated in the room description as included in the resort fee are, "•Newspaper (daily) •Use of in-room safe." There is no daily newspaper. There are no functioning power outlets near the desk. There are 2 on a lamp on the desk top, but they do not work even after a visit by maintenance. The in room telephone is not functional, again, even after a visit from maintenance. There is NO in room safe.

reviews.title: Breathtaking Sunrises
reviews.text: I will also mention that there are holes in the carpeting, and stains on the upholstery that appear to be some kind of whitish fluid. Yes, ewww. The mattresses are about 8" deep with springs that you can feel simply by running you hand over them, and they are more pronounced when lying down. The frame around the door looks as if it has been broken into numerous times, and it is dark outside the door (the light is burned out), so we certainly do not feel safe.

reviews.title: Had a great time in the surf
reviews.text: These accommodations are less than I would expect as a bare minimum at a 2 star property. This property is grossly misrepresented. The accommodations are simply unacceptable by most standards, and especially as compared to this misleading information on the hotel’s web site. I have included pictures of all of the conditions as well as the “ice machine” and an example of the upkeep on the property…as many photos as I was allowed to post.

reviews.title: What a WONDERFUL weekend
reviews.text: The front desk staff were courteous, however, they did not do anything to correct the disgusting accommodations…likely because all rooms are this poor and they can’t reaccommodate us into something they simply do not have.

reviews.title: Great accommodation!
reviews.text: Update: After numerous visits by maintenance we have a working phone and a power strip/extension cord so that we can at least use our computer at the desk. Regardless, are these the kinds of problems you want to be faced with when on vacation?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were married at this resort, on the beach, six years ago. When we returned for our anniversary last weekend, we were able to get the same room we had but it had been renovated. They have done a great job of fixing things and making the resort look better. It's an older property but the location and available activities make it a great place to stay. Beautiful wide beach and a great place to watch rocket launches from the Air Force Base.
reviews.title: Wedding memories on our anniversary

reviews.text: We saw some of the staff that helped us with our wedding six years ago. The folks at the front desk are always attentive, polite and helpful. Derek checked us in last weekend and suggested we consider attending the dinner and magic show on Saturday night. It was wonderful! A complete buffet dinner and show at a discount price.
reviews.title: Best Budget Resort On Cocoa Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to the Cocoa Beach area several times a year and have stayed at many of the hotels. I like to try different ones each time. I had read some negative reviews of the International Palms and so it was with some trepidation that I booked a week’s stay there. I'm a senior contributor to Trip Advisor and try to be fair and objective when writing reviews, so don't be too swayed by the negative reviews until you read this.
reviews.title: Birthday Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the reviews mention mildew smell in the room and when I checked in at 1:30 AM the first room I was offered was so bad that I immediately closed the door and asked to change rooms. I agreed to a $10 per night upgrade to a newly remodeled room and was so glad I did. I don't know why Adam tried to put me there when there were nicer rooms available. That’s about my only gripe with my experience. Be sure to read the part about remodeling the rooms later in this review.
reviews.title: Very Nice Resort

reviews.text: The 2nd room was spacious, had a refrigerator and microwave, coffee maker, table with two chairs, couch and a king bed. The carpet looked new and the bed and bedding were very comfortable. My air conditioner worked great and was not noisy. My room had an older CRT television set, which worked fine, and I didn't come here to watch TV. My room was serviced nicely every day, albeit a bit late in the day. The towels were nice and thick. After spending six nights there I was actually sad to leave.
reviews.title: Fall retreat

aka: International Palms Resort & Conference Center Cocoa Beach Hotel
description: Listen to the soothing waves of the Atlantic Ocean & sink your toes into our white sand beach at the oceanfront Holiday Inn Cocoa Beach Florida Hotel, the finest in Cocoa Beach accommodations. Soak up the sun at our Cocoa Beach Florida resort as you relax beside the largest hotel pool in Cocoa Beach. Kids will have an adventure in our kid-friendly Pirate Ship themed pool. Oh, the choices to make, white sand and boogie boards or wacky water cannons! Adventure seekers will love the challenge of many onsite water sport activities including surfing lessons. The best of Cocoa Beach is just outside your Cocoa Beach, FL, hotel room or one of many spacious suites. Connection to the business world is never far with complimentary high-speed wireless Internet access. The only decision you will need to make is business suit or bathing suit . This spacious oceanfront hotel in Cocoa Beach Fl is located only 7 miles from Port Canaveral and 17 miles from Kennedy Space Center. While in town be sure to visit Ron Jon s Surf Shop, historic Cocoa Village, the Brevard Zoo or many of the Central Florida theme parks. All are a short drive away. Look no further for a hotel in Cocoa Beach, Florida. Paradise is a click away! The Holiday Inn Cocoa Beach Oceanfront Resort hotel is the best choice for your Cocoa Beach lodging.Florida resident discounts are available You must be 21 or older to check in!
